docs.snippet: The blast from a mortar shell killed at least 10 people at Syria’s flagship Damascus University, where students had done their best to go about their business....
docs.lead_paragraph: The blast from a mortar shell killed at least 10 people at Syria’s flagship Damascus University, where students had done their best to go about their business.
docs.abstract: Mortar shell kills at least 10 students and injures 29 at Syria’s flagship Damascus University, where students have done their best to go about their business; Syrian war has transformed lives of many students, some of whom support a military solution that crushes rebel uprising, while most want political settlement.

headline.seo: Damascus Students Killed in Mortar Strike
headline.main: Syria’s War Invades a Campus That Acted as a Sanctuary
headline.print_headline: With Shelling, War Invades Syria Campus

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Damascus; Hania Mourtada from Beirut, Lebanon; Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

docs.snippet: Hundreds of brewers went to Washington this week to seek aid that they said would help them brew more beer and hire more workers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of brewers went to Washington this week to seek aid that they said would help them brew more beer and hire more workers.
docs.abstract: Consortium of craft beer brewers gather for first industry conference in Washington, meeting with Congressional staff members to lobby for tax cut they say will allow them to continue hiring and expanding; craft beer industry has boomed nationwide despite recession.

headline.main: Riding Wave of Popularity, Craft Brewers Ask Congress for a Tax Cut
headline.print_headline: Riding Wave of Popularity, Craft Brewers Ask Congress for a Tax Cut
